content: make a long story short blanket this is a very scrappy sock yarn blanket with very little rules use as many or as little different colors as you like a true stash buster you could easily use any weight yarn and size needles to use up your stash when knitting in sock weight and it measures 48 x 72 there are approx 240 600 stitches there is not a purl stitch in sight just garter nothing but potato chip knitting it is worked in 3 parts plus the border part 1 the width part 2 the length part 3 decreasing to finish rectangle materials  sock yarn approx 3 600 + yards i used scrapes  size 4 36 or greater circular knitting needles  darning needle to sew in ends be prepared if you do a scrappy blanket there will be tons and tons of ends directions in the blanket i made i used two different colors of sock yarn i worked two row of color a dropped color a worked two row of color b dropped color b picked up color a and repeat these two row color change throughout the entire blanket changing colors when i ran out of yarn as i was using scraps or when i wanted a change in the look part 1 the width cast on 3 stitches i use the long tail cast on but whatever you prefer will be acceptable all row k1 kfb k to end of row you will increase one stitch at the beginning of every row until the piece measure across the bottom with right side facing the width you want minus the border i did 48 inches that was 400 stitches in sock weight part 2 the length row 1 k1 k2tog k to end of row row 2 k1 kfb k to end of row you will decrease one stitch at the beginning of row 1 or right side row this will turn the bottom right hand corner of your blanket and increase one stitch at the beginning of row 2 or wrong side row this will make the length of your blanket until the piece measure up the long side the length you want minus the border i did 72 part 3 finish the rectangle all row k1 k2tog k to end of row you will decrease one stitch at the beginning of every row until there are 3 stiches left this will create the rectangle by turning the upper left hand corner and decreasing until to the final corner in the upper right hand side bind off you should now have a rectangle border this is up to you i finished mine with a simple single_crochet edge you could also adapt frankie s knitted stuff ten stitch blanket for a bolder border or there are several beautiful choices in the books knitting on the edge or knitting over the edge both of these books can be purchased on amazon finishing using the darning
